summaryText: Pastor Travis Hearn delivers a powerful message challenging believers to examine their authenticity and spiritual integrity. He tackles the challenging question: Are you truly as advertised in your Christian walk? Drawing from Matthew 7, Pastor Travis unpacks the sobering reality that not everyone who claims to know Jesus actually has a genuine relationship with Him. He exposes the dangers of being a 'hypocrite' - originally meaning an actor on stage - who presents one image publicly while living something entirely different privately. PT breaks down four critical action steps for spiritual growth: taking an honest self-evaluation, making hard decisions to change, being selective about your surroundings, and refusing to get distracted from your spiritual journey. The sermon is a wake-up call, reminding us that Christianity isn't about religious performance, but about an authentic, transformative relationship with Jesus Christ. Pastor Travis challenges listeners to move from being 'pretenders' to experiencing true 'surrender', emphasizing that God is more interested in knowing us deeply than in our external religious activities.
mainPoints: Take an honest look at your spiritual life
Make hard decisions to grow spiritually
Be intentional about your spiritual environment
Stay focused on your relationship with Christ

versesMentioned.text: Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven. Many will say to me on that day, 'Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name and in your name drive out demons and in your name perform many miracles?' Then I will tell them plainly, 'I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!'

Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence. Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean. Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean. In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous, but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Do you not realize that Christ Jesus is in you—unless, of course, you fail the test?
The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives' tales; rather, train yourself to be godly. For physical training is of some value, but godliness has value for all things, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.
Do not be misled: 'Bad company corrupts good character.'
Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.
Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.
But the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.

Monday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind.'
Monday.action: Create a personal audit. Write down three areas where your public and private life might not align. Pray for honest revelation and courage to address these discrepancies.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the hidden parts of my heart. Give me courage to be authentic and transparent before You. Help me align my inner life with my outward profession of faith. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 1:22: 'Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.'
Tuesday.action: Choose one spiritual discipline you've been avoiding. Commit to practicing it daily this week, whether it's prayer, Bible reading, or serving others.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me not just hear Your word, but live it. Give me the strength and resolve to turn my spiritual knowledge into practical action. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Psalm 139:23-24: 'Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.'
Wednesday.action: Spend extended time in prayer asking God to reveal any areas of hypocrisy or inauthentic living. Journal His insights and your response.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I invite Your searching light. Expose anything in me that doesn't reflect Your character. Give me a humble and teachable heart. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 27:17: 'As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.'
Thursday.action: Reach out to a trusted friend or mentor. Ask them to lovingly help you identify blind spots in your spiritual journey.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, surround me with wise, honest friends who will speak truth in love. Help me receive correction with humility and grace. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Friday.action: Create a simple, practical plan to minimize distractions. This might include setting phone boundaries, creating a dedicated prayer space, or scheduling consistent quiet time.
Friday.prayer: God, help me stay focused on You. Remove the distractions that pull me away from Your presence. Align my heart with Your purposes. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Hebrews 12:1-2: 'Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us, fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on the week's insights. Write a personal commitment letter to God, outlining specific ways you'll pursue genuine, Christ-centered living.
Saturday.prayer: Lord Jesus, I surrender my entire self to You. Remove anything that prevents me from being truly Yours. Make me authentic, transparent, and committed to Your way. Amen.
